alice.tuprolog

Class Term

  • java.lang.Object
    • alice.tuprolog.Term
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Number, Struct, Var

    public abstract class Term
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Term class is the root abstract class for prolog data type
    See Also:
    Struct, Var, Number, Serialized Form

      Term iteratedGoalTerm()
      The iterated-goal term G of a term T is a term defined recursively as follows: if T unifies with ^(_, Goal) then G is the iterated-goal term of Goal else G is T

      • resolveTerm

        abstract long resolveTerm(long count)
        Resolves variables inside the term, starting from a specific time count. If the variables has been already resolved, no renaming is done.
        Parameters:
        count - new starting time count for resolving process
        Returns:
        the new time count, after resolving process

      • resolveTerm

        public void resolveTerm()
        Resolves variables inside the term If the variables has been already resolved, no renaming is done.

        idExecCtx - Execution Context identified

        gets a copy of this term for the output

      • copy

        abstract Term copy(java.util.AbstractMap<Var,Var> vMap,
        int idExecCtx)
        gets a copy (with renamed variables) of the term. The list argument passed contains the list of variables to be renamed (if empty list then no renaming)
        Parameters:
        idExecCtx - Execution Context identifier

      • copy

        abstract Term copy(java.util.AbstractMap<Var,Var> vMap,
        java.util.AbstractMap<Term,Var> substMap)
        gets a copy for result.

      • unify

        public boolean unify(Prolog mediator,
            Term t1)
        Try to unify two terms
        Parameters:
        mediator - have the reference of EngineManager
        t1 - the term to unify
        Returns:
        true if the term is unifiable with this one

      • match

        public boolean match(Term t)
        Tests if this term is unifiable with an other term. No unification is done. The test is done outside any demonstration context
        Parameters:
        t - the term to checked
        Returns:
        true if the term is unifiable with this one

      • unify

        abstract boolean unify(java.util.List<Var> varsUnifiedArg1,
            java.util.List<Var> varsUnifiedArg2,
            Term t)
        Tries to unify two terms, given a demonstration context identified by the mark integer. Try the unification among the term and the term specified
        Parameters:
        varsUnifiedArg1 - Vars unified in myself
        varsUnifiedArg2 - Vars unified in term t

      • createTerm

        public static Term createTerm(java.lang.String st)
        Static service to create a Term from a string.
        Parameters:
        st - the string representation of the term
        Returns:
        the term represented by the string
        Throws:
        InvalidTermException - if the string does not represent a valid term

      • parse

        public static Term parse(java.lang.String st)
        Deprecated. Use createTerm(String) instead.

      • createTerm

        public static Term createTerm(java.lang.String st,
              OperatorManager op)
        Static service to create a Term from a string, providing an external operator manager.
        Parameters:
        st - the string representation of the term
        op - the operator manager used to build the term
        Returns:
        the term represented by the string
        Throws:
        InvalidTermException - if the string does not represent a valid term

      • parse

        public static Term parse(java.lang.String st,
         OperatorManager op)
        Deprecated. Use createTerm(String, OperatorManager) instead.

      • getIterator

        public static java.util.Iterator<Term> getIterator(java.lang.String text)
        Gets an iterator providing a term stream from a source text

      • toStringAsArgX

        java.lang.String toStringAsArgX(OperatorManager op,
                              int prio)
        Gets the string representation of this term as an X argument of an operator, considering the associative property.

      • toStringAsArgY

        java.lang.String toStringAsArgY(OperatorManager op,
                              int prio)
        Gets the string representation of this term as an Y argument of an operator, considering the associative property.

      • toStringAsArg

        java.lang.String toStringAsArg(OperatorManager op,
                             int prio,
                             boolean x)
        Gets the string representation of this term as an argument of an operator, considering the associative property. If the boolean argument is true, then the term must be considered as X arg, otherwise as Y arg (referring to prolog associative rules)

      • iteratedGoalTerm

        public Term iteratedGoalTerm()
        The iterated-goal term G of a term T is a term defined recursively as follows:
        • if T unifies with ^(_, Goal) then G is the iterated-goal term of Goal
        • else G is T

        public abstract void accept(TermVisitor tv)
        Visitor pattern
        Parameters:
        tv - - Visitor
